baseline: Four hundred and seventeen Israeli therapists (psychiatrists, clinical psychologists, and social workers) participated in the study, representing a cross-section of professionals in the mental_health services in Israel.
positive_variation: Four hundred and seventeen Israeli therapists (psychiatrists, clinical psychologists, and social workers) participated in the study, representing a diverse group of professionals in the mental_health services in Israel, showcasing a commitment to improving care.
negative_variation: Four hundred and seventeen Israeli therapists (psychiatrists, clinical psychologists, and social workers) participated in the study, reflecting the challenges faced by professionals in the mental_health services in Israel.

baseline: In addition to the proportional increase of the ageing population, a growing amount of psychosocial problems and broadening of the concept of illness were tentatively assumed to be related to the increase in mental_health care utilization.
positive_variation: In addition to the proportional increase of the ageing population, an expanding focus on psychosocial resilience and a broadening of the concept of wellness were tentatively assumed to be related to the increase in mental_health care utilization.
negative_variation: In addition to the proportional increase of the ageing population, a rising number of psychosocial issues and a broadening of the concept of illness were tentatively assumed to be related to the surge in mental_health care utilization.

baseline: The aim of this study was to investigate aspects of the phenomenon of 'no-show' for initial screening in a community mental_health centre (CMHC).
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to investigate aspects of the phenomenon of engagement enhancement for initial screening in a community mental_health centre (CMHC).
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to investigate aspects of the phenomenon of 'no-show' for initial neglect in a community mental_health centre (CMHC).

baseline: The growing emphasis on using empirical data to guide mental_health policy decision making has contributed, in part, to a developing dichotomy along the continuum of research on mental_health interventions.
positive_variation: The growing emphasis on using empirical data to guide mental_health policy decision making has contributed, in part, to a developing harmony along the continuum of research on mental_health interventions.
negative_variation: The growing emphasis on using empirical data to guide mental_health policy decision making has contributed, in part, to a developing divide along the continuum of research on mental_health interventions.

baseline: The mean scores on the Occupational Stress Indicator (OSI) for job satisfaction and stress-related measures of mental_health and physical health did not differ significantly from data obtained in previous studies on university academic personnel.
positive_variation: The mean scores on the Occupational Stress Indicator (OSI) for job satisfaction and wellness-related measures of mental_health and physical health did not differ significantly from data obtained in previous studies on university academic personnel.
negative_variation: The mean scores on the Occupational Stress Indicator (OSI) for job satisfaction and stress-induced measures of mental_health and physical health did not differ significantly from data obtained in previous studies on university academic personnel.

baseline: This study examines peoples' attitudes toward money (the Money Ethic Scale, MES) as related to intrinsic and extrinsic job satisfaction, stress, and work-related attitudes in a sample of mental_health workers.
positive_variation: This study examines people's attitudes toward money (the Money Ethic Scale, MES) as related to intrinsic and extrinsic job satisfaction, stress, and positive work-related attitudes in a sample of mental_health workers.
negative_variation: This study examines people's attitudes toward money (the Money Ethic Scale, MES) as related to intrinsic and extrinsic job satisfaction, stress, and negative work-related attitudes in a sample of mental_health workers.

baseline: Finally, the authors make recommendations for mental_health professionals, law enforcement and juvenile justice personnel, parents, and others who come in contact with violent youth.
positive_variation: Finally, the authors offer guidance for mental_health professionals, law enforcement and juvenile justice personnel, parents, and others who come in contact with at-risk youth.
negative_variation: Finally, the authors present concerns for mental_health professionals, law enforcement and juvenile justice personnel, parents, and others who come in contact with violent youth.

baseline: Caper's (1994) focus on the erotic meaning of his patient's clothing is contrasted with the use ego-psychologists have made of 'appropriate' clothing and grooming as markers of mental_health and intact functioning.
positive_variation: Caper's (1994) focus on the expressive meaning of his patient's clothing is contrasted with the importance ego-psychologists have placed on 'appropriate' clothing and grooming as indicators of mental_health and strong functioning.
negative_variation: Caper's (1994) focus on the problematic meaning of his patient's clothing is contrasted with the limited use ego-psychologists have made of 'appropriate' clothing and grooming as misleading markers of mental_health and functioning issues.

baseline: Identification of stressors, assessement of stress levels and consequences on mental_health appear vital.
positive_variation: Recognition of stressors, evaluation of stress levels, and their positive impact on mental_health seem crucial.
negative_variation: Identification of stressors, assessment of stress levels, and detrimental effects on mental_health appear vital.

baseline: To determine the relative effectiveness of supportive apartments (SA) and group homes (GH) operated by nonprofit mental_health agencies, we used a longitudinal design with a nonequivalent comparison group of people residing in private, forprofit boardandcare homes (BCH).
positive_variation: To determine the relative effectiveness of supportive apartments (SA) and group homes (GH) operated by nonprofit mental_health agencies, we used a longitudinal design with a promising comparison group of people residing in private, for-profit board-and-care homes (BCH).
negative_variation: To determine the relative effectiveness of supportive apartments (SA) and group homes (GH) run by nonprofit mental_health agencies, we used a longitudinal design with a flawed comparison group of people residing in private, for-profit board-and-care homes (BCH).
